title: The Science of Pain
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Science of Pain usable.

hook.text: Pain is not in your body. It's constructed entirely in your brain.

discovery.text: The brain interprets these signals and decides how much pain to create.

twist.text: Soldiers in battle sometimes feel no pain from severe wounds â€” the brain suppresses it under stress.

climax.text: Phantom limb pain proves the brain can generate pain in a body part that no longer exists.

punchline.text: Pain is an opinion your brain forms, not a fact your body reports.
